title: undefined reference to torch::jit::load(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)'
body_html:
Hi all

I'm trying to build a tiny c++ executable that loads a model from a file. I was able to build pytorch on my ubuntu machine. Unfortunatly, I don't manage to build my app and compilation always fails with:

martin@martin-VirtualBox:~/Dev/caffe2_cpp$ make
g++ -o myapp \
-I../_includes/protobuf-3.6.1/src \
-I../pytorch/torch/lib/include/ \
-L../pytorch/build/lib \
-l:libcaffe2.so \
-l:libtorch.so \
myapp.cpp
/usr/bin/ld: /tmp/cc8ZivjU.o: in function `main':
myapp.cpp:(.text+0x4a): undefined reference to `torch::jit::load(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make: *** [Makefile:2: testapp] Error 1

As far as I understand it just cannot find the implementation of the load() method anywhere, even though I included/linked (?) libtorch.so

I hope anyone can help me, Thank you!

body:
Hi all

I'm trying to build a tiny c++ executable that loads a model from a file. I was able to build pytorch on my ubuntu machine. Unfortunatly, I don't manage to build my app and compilation always fails with:

```
martin@martin-VirtualBox:~/Dev/caffe2_cpp$ make
g++ -o myapp \
-I../_includes/protobuf-3.6.1/src \
-I../pytorch/torch/lib/include/ \
-L../pytorch/build/lib \
-l:libcaffe2.so \
-l:libtorch.so \
myapp.cpp
/usr/bin/ld: /tmp/cc8ZivjU.o: in function `main':
myapp.cpp:(.text+0x4a): undefined reference to `torch::jit::load(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make: *** [Makefile:2: testapp] Error 1
```

As far as I understand it just cannot find the implementation of the load() method anywhere, even though I included/linked (?) libtorch.so

I hope anyone can help me, Thank you!
